intro: Bigelowia dracunculoides, commonly known as the goldenweed, is a perennial herb native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It features showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant has a fibrous root system and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Botanically, it belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and wind-dispersed seeds.
